description:
The **AWSSupport-AnalyzeEBSResourceUsage** runbook checks for
- All the Elastic Block Storage(EBS) volumes in available state 
- All Elastic Block Storage(EBS) Snapshots for which source Elastic Block Storage(EBS) volume have been deleted
- All Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) which are not in use by any non-terminated Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances 

The runbook generates CSV reports and stores them in a user-provided Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket. The provided bucket should be secured following AWS security best practices as outlined in th. If the user provided Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket does not exist in the account, then runbook creates a new Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket with name in format **<User-provided-name>-awssupport-YYYY-MM-DD**, encrypted with custom Key Management Service (KMS) key, with object versioning enabled, blocked public access, and non-SSL requests blocked.

## Important:
Using this runbook might incur extra charges against your account for the creation of S3 bucket and objects. See [Amazon S3 Pricing](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/pricing/) for more details on the charges that my be incurred

S3BucketName.description: (Optional) The Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket in your account to upload the report to. Please make sure the bucket policy does not grant unnecessary read/write permissions to parties that do not need access to the collected logs. If the bucket specified does not exist in the account, then automation will create a new bucket in region where automation is executed with name format **<User-provided-name>-awssupport-YYYY-MM-DD**, encrypted with custom Key Management Service (KMS) key

CustomerManagedKmsKeyArn.description: (Optional) The custom KMS key ARN for encrypting the new Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket that will be created in case the bucket specified does not exist in the account. Automation will fail if bucket creation is attempted without specifing custom KMS key ARN

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If role is not specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permission of the user that runs this document.

mainSteps.name: checkConcurrency
mainSteps.description: Ensures there is only one execution of this runbook in the region. If the runbook finds another execution in progress, it returns an error and ends.

mainSteps.name: verifyOrCreateS3bucket
mainSteps.description: Verifies if the Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket exists. If not, creates a new Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket in region where automation is executed with the name format **<User-provided-name>-awssupport-YYYY-MM-DD**, encrypted with custom Key Management Service (KMS) key

mainSteps.name: gatherAmiDetails
mainSteps.description: Searches for Amazon Machine Image (AMI), which are not in use by any EC2 instances, generates the report with name format **<region>-images.csv** and uploads it to the Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket.

mainSteps.name: gatherVolumeDetails
mainSteps.description: Checks Elastic Block Storage(EBS) volumes in available state, generates the report with name format **<region>-volume.csv** and uploads it in Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket.

mainSteps.name: gatherSnapshotDetails
mainSteps.description: Looks for the Elastic Block Storage(EBS) snapshots of the EBS volumes that are deleted already, generates the report with name format <region>-snapshot.csv and uploads it to  Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket.
